glsa.title: libgtop: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: libgtop improperly handles filenames, possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: libgtop facilitates the libgtop_daemon, which is used by GNOME to obtain information about remote systems.

description.p: Liu Qishuai discovered that glibtop_get_proc_map_s() in sysdeps/linux/procmap.c does not properly allocate memory for storing a filename, allowing certain filenames to cause the buffer to overflow on the stack.

impact.p: By tricking a victim into executing an application that uses the libgtop library (e.g. libgtop_daemon or gnome-system-monitor), a local attacker could specify a specially crafted filename to be used by libgtop causing a buffer overflow and possibly execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
